content.question: The Maclaurin series for the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="the sum from n equals 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, negative 2, close parenthesis, to the n power, times x raised to the 2 n power, and denominator n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="the fourth derivative of f evaluated at 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 10.11: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor Polynomial Approximations of Functions

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
